title: Copywriter to join us in Köping
description:
Are you the Copywriter that wants to join our creative studio team in Köping ready to tell the story - in English and Swedish - of how extraordinary sleep is changing peoples’ lives?

**About us**

  

At Hästens, we strive for a world where people sleep well – one that’s more joyful, peaceful and loving. Every day since 1852, we continue to hone our world-class craft in our factory in Köping, Sweden.


Sleep may be today’s ultimate modern luxury. But it’s more than that; it’s a biological necessity and the foundation of our entire wellbeing. We want people to sleep well so that they can create the future they dream of upon waking. That’s why our master craftsmen consider and handcraft every detail of our bespoke designs using only the finest natural materials.


We are proud to be a world-class international brand, operating in more than 40 countries with over 300 partners in Europe, Asia, America and Africa – and still growing.  

  

**A little bit more about the job**


You will join us during a time of exciting worldwide expansion as an English-language Copywriter. In this role, within our Global Marketing team, you will be a creative problem solver who is passionate about telling stories and crafting work that redefines how we think of sleep. You're a conceptual thinker who can bring your ideas to life in new and inspiring ways. You must be comfortable working across all mediums including editorial, print, film, in-store, social, mobile, digital, experience, OOH & internal communication.


What is key is having a holistic narrative and deep understanding for our brand and brand values. You have a strong point of view on concept and story on behalf of a brand, whether on a product label or in a long-form script. When you decide to make something, you see your vision through from concept to launch.

**Hästens** is in a high-growth phase as a company, so this position will be pivotal in safeguarding our mission through the written word.

**You are the greatest at:**

* Articulating big ideas and narratives, including product selling points for all mediums, including editorial print, film & content, social, product, in-store, interactive, activations, OOH, print, mobile, events, newsletters, experiential, press releases, etc.
* Elevating the narrative communication of Hästens to a higher level by creating compelling writing focused on engaging and converting our customers and partners
* Understanding how writing and conceptual ideas can be used to tell a story on behalf of a brand and within a consumer experience
* Writing editorial for our catalogue and crafting our brand story, journalistic experience and approach to writing is a plus
* Ensuring that the tone-of-voice of Hästens is clearly defined and up to date and assist in establishing templates and guidance documents for global deployment. This includes the continuous evolution of the Hästens Guidelines to document how writing and brand expression is executed for internal and external partners
* Communicate Hästens news and highlights through our internal Check-In site
* Part of the role will be to support our local markets with local press releases, event invites & advertisements across traditional and digital touch points

 **We believe that you have**

* Relevant academic degree within journalism, copywriting, language studies is a plus
* 3+ years experience in concepting and writing copy for global brands, ideally on both agency and client-side
* A portfolio that demonstrates your ability to write clear and elevated copy for a variety of subjects and channels
* Native (or as good as native) in English, fluent in Swedish, other languages are a benefit
* Adobe Creative Cloud core applications experience is a plus
* Experience in using tools such as macOS and Microsoft Office365 (Teams, Word, PowerPoint, Excel, SharePoint/OneDrive), Monday.com, Zoom, Social Media platforms like Instagram, Facebook, WeChat, TikTok)
Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal skills  
* 

**Recruitment process**

  

We are diligent when screening for the talent, perks of that is that you will work with equally fantastic people.


Hang in there and be persistent in the recruitment process that consists of the following:

* You apply with your CV, a short cover letter and a portfolio
* We send you a personality and logic test
* You will get the chance to get to know different stakeholders in interviews
* We will ask you to write a sample writing test
* and maybe something more that pops up, but just because we are curious people

  

Apply early, we review applications on a rolling basis.

title: Application Manager till Envirotainer
description:
*Are you passionate about driving continuous development and governance for various applications? As an Application Manager at Envirotainer, you will bridge the gap between IT and the business, translating business needs into technical solutions. You will play a key role in our growing company, delivering exceptional IT solutions alongside a dedicated team of professionals.*
**About The Job**
 As an Application Manager at Envirotainer, your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Developing a strategic view on applications to meet customer needs both short- and long-term.
* Continuously defining requirements and driving changes in close collaboration with the business.
* Managing vendors and suppliers related to the applications.
* Ensuring applications comply with regulations, correct licenses, and are updated to the latest versions.
* Maintaining and securing application documentation, governance plans, technical documentation, and roadmaps.
* Monitoring and following up on application availability and performance.
* Overseeing the support and maintenance budget for the applications, including support costs, licenses, and development costs.
* Acting as 3rd line support and leading incident management related to the applications.


 This position is located in Rotebro, with flexibility to work partly remote. Some travel to other offices may be required.
   

  

**Who Are You**
 To succeed at Envirotainer, you'll need strong planning and social skills to meet stakeholder needs. You're someone who works well independently to achieve goals, while also being a team player who enjoys supporting colleagues.
   

  

 Qualifications:
   

  

* Experience of working with application governance and/or application development.
* A bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field is desirable, but relevant experience can compensate.
* Fluent English in speaking and writing.


 Experience of Azure components and agile development processes is meritorious.
   

  

**About Us**
 We are a global company that built an entire industry almost 40 years ago. We now bring more than 2,000,000 doses per day of much-needed medicines to patients across the world and our ambition is to double that over the next couple of years.
   

  

 Currently, we are around 400 dedicated specialists in 20 countries that develops, manufactures, and offers leasing options of innovative container solutions for pharmaceutical products that require a controlled environment. We do this jointly together with our partners with the belief that it takes an Eco-system to safely deliver medicines to the people that depend upon them. In time, to the right place and in the right condition.
   

  

**Application and contact**
 In this recruitment, Envirotainer is collaborating with Wise IT. If you would like to know more about the job, please contact the responsible recruitment consultant, Anja Widell, at anja.widell@wiseit.se.
   

  

 Unfortunately, Wise IT cannot accept applications via email, as we value your personal privacy. You can read more about how we handle personal data according to GDPR in the Wise Group’s policy for the processing of personal data.
   

  

 Selection is ongoing after 12/8. Welcome with your application!

title: Service Designer (m/f/d)
description:

**Service Designer - Public 360⁰ Tietoevry Industry**
 Are you interested in designing new and innovative solutions that are cutting edge in one of the largest tech companies in the Nordics? Then this is the role for you!
   

  

 We are looking for a Service Designer who is ready to be part of a team that is creating a positive impact for both our clients and the world. Tietoevry is an innovative frontrunner specializing in segment-specific software and data platform services. Our solutions are designed in close collaboration with our customers and based on our extensive industry knowledge and in-depth expertise.
   

  

 As Tietoevry our ambition is to give meaning and life to information through ideas, technology, and solutions that create value for our customers and benefit the society we live in. Our Mission is to "Reinvent the world for good".
   

  

**When joining** 
**Tietoevry** 
**Industry as a Service Designer:**
* You join a skilled team of consultants, solution architects, and designers who closely collaborate and learn from each other.
* You will become an expert in understanding and translating key customer needs into innovative services that will meet the market and business needs.
* You will conceptualize, detail, iterate and visualize the planning and arrangement of people, infrastructure, and communications with the aim to improve the quality and interaction between our services and our users.
* You will lead the development of service concepts, blueprints, and other service design artifacts meanwhile establishing and managing the relationship with our customers.

**Who We Are Looking For**
* You have a university degree in either Service Design, Design Research, or Strategy Design.
* You have 5 to 10 years of work experience in the field of Service Design or Business Design.
* You are a team player and excel in working collaboratively with customers and cross-functional team members.
* You have experience in a management role leading multi-disciplinary teams to produce coherent and effective design solutions.
* Your knowledge of existing and emerging design tools and methods is top-notch.
* You have strong organizational skills and eye for detail.
* You can be both hands-on and strategic.
* You are fluent in English, verbally & writing, and speak an additional Nordic language (Norwegian, Swedish, Finnish or Danish).


 As a person, we believe you are a team player who takes action and demonstrates responsibility to organize your work and solve your tasks. With our agile end-to-end development process, you will continue to both learn from, and coach your colleagues, so communication is important for us.
   

  

**We also believe you have**
* The ability to bring together research, design, business, and technology to shape the services of the future.
* Drive to grow the Service Design discipline and a new generation of talented design practitioners in the team.
* Experience in running online and offline workshops.
* Represent service design in new business development efforts from proposal development to pitch meetings.


**We offer**
 We offer you professional growth, meaningful projects, open culture, and an outstanding work-life balance! We offer you an opportunity to be part of creating the future of a growing, fast-developing, and important sector. We believe that our organizational culture is an important part of enabling you to be successful. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working. Finally, we also believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle where you need to unlearn and relearn every day as new possibilities emerge.
   

  

**Did we get you inspired?**
 We look forward to your application!
   

  

 Please attach your Portfolio, CV or LinkedIn-profile and we’ll reach out to you. Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact the hiring manager Andre Fangueiro, andre.fangueiro@tietoevry.com
   

  

**Hope to hear from you soon!**
 Location: Our Team is digital but we would like to see our colleagues in our offices Norway; Finland (Espoo, Helsinki) Denmark (Copenhagen) Sweden.
   

  

**Application deadline:** 
 30th August 2024
   

  

*We perform background checks on all final candidates.*
*Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.*
*Tietoevry thrives with diversity, and we welcome applicants of all genders, ages, abilities, ethnicities, orientations, beliefs, and backgrounds.*
**About Tietoevry**
 Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
   

  

 Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprise and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs. Familiar yourself with what we do
   

  

 Creating purposeful technology to reinvent the world for good
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Harmony Solutions Sales Manager Nordics
description:
Why Join Us?
   

  

 Join Check Point's world-leading sales team!
   

  

 At Check Point, we recognize and value the unique talents of our employees. We challenge ourselves to grow, develop, and perform better and faster. We promote integrity and teamwork to allow everyone to excel.
   

  

 If you want to work in a multi-cultural environment with cutting-edge technology, then Check Point Software Technologies is where you want to be.
   

  

 Be a part of a fast-paced growing company and explore new opportunities. Join now!
   

  

 Check Point is looking for a talented and experienced Sales Manager to be based in Sweden.
   

  

 You'll integrate a team of sales experts to support the sales effort in Europe and build strong relationships with European employees as well as R&D, Support, and other international teams.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

* Define and implement the strategy within the territory
* Develop sales and marketing plans to drive revenue
* Serve as a single point of contact and knowledge for Channels and End users
* Train, educate, and support our sales forces internally
* Recruit and manage specialized VAR partners
* Demonstrate and present our solutions to end users and partner executives
* Identify new business opportunities
* Define and deliver sales forecasts
* Take full ownership of the role, manage conflicting constraints, and drive each project to successful completion


 This position is relevant for candidates in Sweden, Norway, Finland, and Denmark.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* 5 years in a Field Sales position with a software company or technology-related company
* Background in selling security solutions to Enterprise customers preferred
* Strong selling skills in major accounts, with an understanding of large business organizations and their buying cycles
* Willingness to call into executive contacts and strategically position Check Point as a business solution, and not just a product fit
* A proven track record of success is critical
* Must be a self-starter, who is self-sufficient with a positive attitude, and a strong closer
* Experience with Salesforce or similar Sales tracking tools as well as strong MS Office skills


 Join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity with your expertise and passion for innovation!
   

  

 Apply now and be part of a team that's leading the way in cybersecurity technology.

title: Data Engineer
description:
MAJORITY is a groundbreaking digital banking service for migrants, nomads, internationals and immigrants. Our all-in-one membership includes an FDIC-insured account, Visa® Prepaid card, international money transfers, cross-border, bill pay solutions and international calling. We are built for migrants, by migrants.
   

  

 Global migration is a 21st-century reality. Whether people are following their dreams, love or new experiences, more and more of us are leaning towards new environments. Our purpose at MAJORITY is to empower the amazing, the brave, and the talented and help them achieve all of their ambitions.
   

  

 We believe that everyone deserves the same opportunity to succeed. Our mission is to provide migrants the tools to thrive in their new country. Come join us! Our team mirrors our global audience: we are a diverse team of people from over 20 different countries that get together everyday – and we’d love for you to join us. Are you the right person to join our diverse team of highly ambitious migrants?
   

  

**The role**
 Are you interested in joining our data team? We're currently looking for a Data Engineer who can help us take our data stack to the next level. Your skills will be crucial in driving the technical architecture and roadmap of our company. As part of our team, you'll get to work on a variety of tasks, including integrating APIs with AWS Lambdas, conducting advanced SQL queries, working with data streams, and visualizing data using Looker and Count. This is an exciting opportunity for you to play a major role in shaping our data infrastructure.
   

  

 Our data platform is key in helping migrants from all over the world!
   

  

 Current stack: BigQuery, dbt, Looker, Count, Airflow, Kubernetes, AWS (Kinesis, S3, Lamda), GCP (PubSub, CloudFunctions), Terraform, ChatGPT/CoPilot
   

  

**The team’s responsibility**
* Design, build and maintain our data platform architecture, empowering our business intelligence.
* Build a scalable event streaming infrastructure to enable real-time analytics use cases.
* Model our data in our BigQuery DW with dbt.
* Help drive towards DataOps by building robust testing coverage and CI/CD pipelines to ensure data quality and high availability.
* Govern data architecture to produce robust dataflows.
* Interact with business stakeholders to understand their needs & collaborate to build the solution the business needs.


**Experience we seek**
* 2+ Years in Data Engineering/Data analysis or similar
* MSc (or equivalent) in Engineering, Computer Science (or relevant professional experience)
* Experience in modelling and building data platform architectures
* Experience in ELT techniques and data warehouses
* Experience with Data Ops
* Some or all technologies: SQL, dbt, Python, Airflow, AWS/GCP, and event-bus tech like Kinesis/PubSub data stream.


**Additional appreciated experience**
* Experience from a fintech company with digital products
* Experience with Looker or similar visualization tools
* Experience with ML and ML Ops
* Experience with Kubernetes


**What we offer**
 We are Majority. People from all around the world, as of now more than 20 countries and more to come. We believe in equal opportunity and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
   

  

 We provide a competitive salary, ample vacation time, and a strong pension plan as a reward for your dedication and hard work.
